available.description: Whether every replication link is up

active_since.description: Since what time the alert is active

BdbPasswordRequest.description: Request body for database password operations

password.description: The password to add, delete, or set

bdb_uid.description: BDB UID that this certificate belongs to

not_after.description: Date the certificate is valid until. Parsed from the certificate.

not_before.description: Date the certificate is valid from. Parsed from the certificate.

ChangePasswordHashingAlgorithmRequest.description: Request to change the cluster password hashing algorithm

algorithm.description: The password hashing algorithm to use for all users

certificates.description: List of certificates in the cluster

nodes.description: List of nodes in the cluster

active_alerts.description: List of active alerts for the database

flex_shards_in_use.description: Number of Flex shards in use by databases in the cluster

flex_shards_limit.description: Flex shards limit specified in cluster license

ram_shards_in_use.description: Number of RAM shards in use by databases in the cluster

ram_shards_limit.description: RAM shards limit specified in cluster license

shards_in_use.description: Accumulated number of shards in use by databases in the cluster

shards_limit.description: Shards limit specified in cluster license

free_provisional_ram.description: Remaining ram for provisioning new shards on the node

free_ram.description: Free ram the node has in bytes

overbooking_depth.description: How much the node is overbooked or has capacity remaining, like free provisional ram but takes into account shards_overbooking (can be negative if it is overbooked)

total_provisional_ram.description: Total ram for provisioning shards on the node

total_ram.description: Total ram the node has in bytes

ephemeral_memory_path.description: Path to ephemeral storage on the node

ephemeral_memory_size.description: Size of ephemeral storage on the node in bytes

in_maintenance.description: Whether the node is in maintenance mode

observed_at.description: Unix time in seconds when the value was last written in the CCS

persistent_memory_path.description: Path to persistent storage on the node

persistent_memory_size.description: Size of persistent storage on the node in bytes

quorum_only.description: Whether the node is quorum-only (does not accept servers)

role.description: Node role can be leader or follower

version.description: RS version installed on the node

PasswordHashMethod.description: Used when password is passed pre-hashed

Permissions.description: API and UI permissions for a role

RedisAcl.description: An API object that represents a Redis ACL definition.

account_id.description: SM account ID associated with this ACL.

action_uid.description: Action uid. If exists - progress can be tracked by the GET /actions/<uid> API

max_version.description: Maximum Redis version for which this ACL is valid.

min_version.description: Minimum Redis version for which this ACL is valid.

Resource.description: Defines a resource for a role, restricting access to specific resources.

uids.description: List of resource UIDs this role has access to.

ResourceType.description: Type of resource for scoping role access.

Role.description: An API object that represents a Redis Software role.

RoleBody.description: Common role properties shared across role payloads.

account_id.description: Account ID. Only applicable to account-scoped roles.

permissions.description: Explicit permissions for this role. If not specified, permissions are inherited from the management role.

resources.description: Resources that restrict this role's access to specific resources.

uid.description: Optional uid to assign to the role.

RolesWithPermissions.description: A map of role names to their permissions

Service.description: Services running on the node managed by supervisor

status.description: Status of the service corresponding to the statename returned by supervisor

role.description: shard role can be leader or follower

status.description: shard status can be up or trimming

User.description: An API object that represents an Redis Software Cluster user.

action_uid.description: Action uid. If exists - progress can be tracked by the GET /actions/<uid> API

bdbs_email_alerts.description: UIDs of databases that user will receive alerts for.

certificate_subject_line.description: The certificate's subject line as defined by RFC2253 (for certificate based authentication users only)

cluster_email_alerts.description: Activate cluster email alerts for a user.

email.description: User's email. (pattern matching only ascii characters)

email_alerts.description: Activate email alerts for a user.

last_login.description: Timestamp of the user's last login time. This denotes the last time an authentication with the user's credentials was successful.

name.description: User's name. (pattern does not allow non ascii and special characters &,<,>,")

password.description: User's password. Note that it could also be an already-hashed value, in which case 'password_hash_method' parameter is also provided.

password_issue_date.description: The date in which the password was set.

role_uids.description: List of role uids associated with the user

bdbs_email_alerts.description: UIDs of databases that user will receive alerts for.

certificate_subject_line.description: The certificate's subject line as defined by RFC2253 (for certificate based authentication users only)

cluster_email_alerts.description: Activate cluster email alerts for a user.

email_alerts.description: Activate email alerts for a user.

name.description: User's name. (pattern does not allow non ascii and special characters &,<,>,")

password.description: User's password for regular authentication. Required for regular auth method.

role_uids.description: List of role uids associated with the user

info.description: Redis Software REST API reference. This API reference is still a work in progress. For more API paths, see the [REST API requests](https://redis.io/docs/latest/operate/rs/references/rest-api/requests/) reference pages.
info.title: Redis Software REST API

delete.description: Delete a password from the database's default user password list
delete.summary: Delete a password from a database's default user

post.description: Add a new password to the database's default user password list for AUTH authentication
post.summary: Add a password to a database's default user

put.description: Reset the database's default user to a single password, replacing all existing passwords
put.summary: Reset a database's default user password

patch.description:
Change the password hashing algorithm used for all users in the cluster.
This will re-hash all existing user passwords with the new algorithm.
patch.summary: Change the cluster password hashing algorithm

post.description: Create a new Redis ACL with the provided configuration

parameters.name: dry_run
